meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a loud, resounding noise.
meanings.sent1: He was whanging the drum with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith was whanging the hammer on the anvil.
meanings.sent3: The kids were whanging pots and pans together in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The storm was whanging against the windows, making the whole house shake.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's hammer whanging on the wood echoed through the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The whanging of the church bells could be heard across the village.
meanings.sent2: The sudden whanging of the gong startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The whanging of the old grandfather clock always made the cat jump.
meanings.sent4: The whanging of the fireworks filled the night sky with color and sound.
meanings.sent5: The whanging of the metal gate could be heard from far away.
